result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Lynn Slaviero

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:36 AM Defendant Nicole Lynn Slaviero in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Nicole Lynn Slaviero.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal states defendant waives preliminary in 22CF342 and 22CF378. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing as freely and voluntarily made. Court binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court sets arraignment in 22CF342 and 22CF378.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Johanna Marie Abell.

1:30 PM Defendant Nicole Lynn Slaviero appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Nicole Lynn Slaviero making a special appearance.  Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $500 cash bail. No contact with Johanna Marie Abell. Notes defendant is on a DJOC and is on probation in WI and MN while having been alleged to commit new crimes. State recites defendant's previous criminal convictions, including bail jumping charges and numerous previous FTAs. State notes that there is currently a probation hold. Attorney Hoffman indicates that she has been a resident of the county for 20 years and has local employment. Defendant verifies that she is on a DOC hold, may be released from hold soon. Defendant does not have access to money to post.
Court orders $1000 cash bail. Noes that there is still a hold. No contact with Johanna Marie Abell. 
Defendant waives time limit for preliminary hearing to allow time to retain counsel. Court accepts waiver. Defendant asks for 30 days. State has no objection, notes that she should have time to retain counsel by then.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
